channel.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
channel.description:
[hr] [u][b]How does this work?[/b][/u] When doing bluurrs client for project Tobex, I realised - people like downloadable clients - too. Here is EasyBluurrs V1 - The simplest client to edit - Everything can be done from Run Client.bat ! From run client.bat you can do the following: [ul][li]Change Name of client (Also changes in the title bar)[/li] [li]Change the Server IP[/li] [li]Change the port[/li] [li]Change the detail (high,low)[/li][/ul] [b]This is for people who can't be bothered making a whole client then compiling and uploading in a rar file - there is only two files inside the package, loader.jar and Run Client.bat - edit everything from this, then re package, re upload and re distribute, nobody will even think of looking inside the Run Client.bat :P[/b] As for features, this client is the best, comes with auto cache downloading, new RS Sky, new RS login screen, new fixed cache, loads of items, ids are same as most other bluur clients, for other features you're gonna have to check shkic's topic. Package is 1.62mb in total! Download - http://www.mediafire.com/?sharekey=3e271abfdb2f06bbe62ea590dc5e5dbbe04e75f6e8ebb871 (Mirrors will be credited) [hr] Pictures: New login [img]http://img190.imageshack.us/img190/139/dsfssddsf.png[/img] Usage:
@ECHO OFF ECHO Bluurr's Client by Shkic and Tobias222 is loading... title Tobias222 java -jar -Xmx500m loader.jar [b]TobiasScape 127.0.0.1 43594 high[/b] program - command - memory - jarfile -[b] Title / Client Name - ip - port - detail[/b] color 565 @ECHO ON @ECHO OFF pause
[hr] Credits: Tobias222 - 10% Shkic - 20% Bluurr - 70%

item.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:13, topic:281538”][quote author=tobias222 link=topic=371723.msg2808510#msg2808510 date=1243865776]

you cant really edit it, you can change the basics of it. This is what makes people think they’ve written their own client when they’ve changed 4 lines of text

None of us have written our own client anyway, most people just do ‘tuts’ and think they’re expert, except for moparisthebest, who has came the closest by re factoring one.
[/quote]
i dont see the relevance of that to my post[/quote]

Sorry, I thought you were complaining about the amount of people who change a few lines then claim they have written their own client, well if you were, nobody has actually done much work on any client except for moparisthebest and a few people.

Finally i finished converting to webclient lol, now its up on tobex for y’all to use.

Read full topic

item.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

sanga282:

you cant really edit it, you can change the basics of it. This is what makes people think they’ve written their own client when they’ve changed 4 lines of text

None of us have written our own client anyway, most people just do ‘tuts’ and think they’re expert, except for moparisthebest, who has came the closest by re factoring one.

Wow, Nice Idea. It’ll help those…noobs…from Complaining about Compiling So much.

Thanks

[quote="_ikram, post:7, topic:281538"]Very good idea, implementing this into batch files, and routing it.
I’d rather use simple configuration format’s though.[/quote]
Me too, but as I said before, it would be too obvious, this can also help people who simply just don’t have time for making a client.

[quote=“aaronvdw, post:6, topic:281538”]if you cant use a compiler or know what it is , how would you ever be a code then ? Ofcourse everyone has to learn , but if u cant use a compiler its pretty sad.
I wont say everyone is dumb who doesnt know , but it gets close. In every tut got explained , if your done. double click your compiler and voíla. something like that.
People read tuts to learn , so why dont those guys know ? if you wanna do a server , you cant do it easy. you need to learn how it works , thats a fact.[/quote]
You’re right, and don’t blame me because I wrote a damn good tutorial on how to get a working compiler, and it wasn’t even approved, so I did my bit to help the community - and got it shoved back in my face.

Someone should just make a batch file that finds your JDK if you have it, then stores it in a variable for compiling usage.

I can make this as advanced as you want, but keep in mind it will be hard to keep track of which argument does what.

Read full topic

item.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

[quote=“aaronvdw, post:4, topic:281538”]Compiling is so hard…C’mon it’s the easiest thing of coding. Clicking on Compiler and then press your keyboard.
People who really want a own client cant use this one , they cant change files or something. It’s good for beginners
but it aint good for people who really need a decent server.

anyways its a nice job…[/quote]

It is easy but you have to understand that it’s hard for beginners because they often have absolutely no idea how a programming language works. Most new people who come here just know that programming is when you edit magical code to create a program.

Read full topic

item.source: The easiest client to edit - No compiling

item.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[quote=“The cook from runescape, post:2, topic:281538”]Good idea, most people seem to find compiling so damned hard

A suggestion, maybe you could make a version with more settings but store them in a settings file which the jar reads. Things such as the option for the users to input their own server or a background image url.

You could also add a version setting feature so the client can switch to a different type (317, 474, 508 etc). You could achieve this by packing a few servers into the jar and making it download the new cache when they change it.[/quote]

Yeah, we can have up to 127 arguments (I think) inside the bat file, I know an .ini file would be good (like some delta bases), but that would make it more obvious that the person put no work in at all, people would edit the .ini file, but nobody ever thinks of editing a run file if they have java properly installed. We can still do the custom background image thing, and i’m thinking of making a v2 with LOADS of options, and just posting a list of what they mean in a table or something

Read full topic
item.source: The easiest client to edit - No compiling

item.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Good idea, most people seem to find compiling so damned hard

A suggestion, maybe you could make a version with more settings but store them in a settings file which the jar reads. Things such as the option for the users to input their own server or a background image url.

You could also add a version setting feature so the client can switch to a different type (317, 474, 508 etc). You could achieve this by packing a few servers into the jar and making it download the new cache when they change it.

Read full topic

item.title: The easiest client to edit - No compiling
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[hr]
How does this work?
When doing bluurrs client for project Tobex, I realised - people like downloadable clients - too.
Here is EasyBluurrs V1 - The simplest client to edit - Everything can be done from Run Client.bat !
From run client.bat you can do the following:

[ul][li]Change Name of client (Also changes in the title bar)[/li]
[li]Change the Server IP[/li]
[li]Change the port[/li]
[li]Change the detail (high,low)[/li][/ul]

This is for people who can’t be bothered making a whole client then compiling and uploading in a rar file - there is only two files inside the package, loader.jar and Run Client.bat - edit everything from this, then re package, re upload and re distribute, nobody will even think of looking inside the Run Client.bat

As for features, this client is the best, comes with auto cache downloading, new RS Sky, new RS login screen, new fixed cache, loads of items, ids are same as most other bluur clients, for other features you’re gonna have to check shkic’s topic.

Package is 1.62mb in total!

Download - http://www.mediafire.com/?sharekey=3e271abfdb2f06bbe62ea590dc5e5dbbe04e75f6e8ebb871
(Mirrors will be credited)

[hr]

Pictures:
New login

Usage:

@ECHO OFF ECHO Bluurr's Client by Shkic and Tobias222 is loading... title Tobias222 java -jar -Xmx500m loader.jar [b]TobiasScape 127.0.0.1 43594 high[/b] program - command - memory - jarfile -[b] Title / Client Name - ip - port - detail[/b] color 565 @ECHO ON

@ECHO OFF
pause

[hr]
Credits:
Tobias222 - 10%
Shkic - 20%
Bluurr - 70%

Read full topic
